pageContext.description: 2 Rivets one of which is shown. Point of dagger (separate) is smooth but a little encrusted. Some very thin light green patina with golden bronze showing on one side.
pageContext.patina: Thin light green patina stained black with golden bronze showing.
pageContext.surface: Rather rough on one side surface is a good deal smoother. Encrusted bright green mixed with gravel.
pageContext.other: Length: 174mm; 52mm point; 17mm point,Width: 42mm; 30.5mm; 20.5mm,Weight: dagger 103.9 gms; Rivet 7 gms; Point 9.4 gms
pageContext.associations: Found in a bell barrow with a burnt internment, a smaller dagger-blade and some slint scrapers.
pageContext.collection: Society of Antiquaries,Burlington House W.,Presented by J. W. Flower, Esq., 1870
pageContext.toSearch: Cranmore, Shepton Mallet, Somerset Ba4, UK
